function.description: The page should have a clean and intuitive layout, making it easy for users to navigate.
Provide input fields for the user's weight in kilograms or pounds, and height in centimeters or inches.
Allow users to select their preferred units of measurement for both weight and height.
Include a button that users can click to calculate their BMI once they've entered their data.
Display the calculated BMI value clearly along with a classification (e.g., underweight, normal weight, overweight).
Provide brief information on what the different BMI categories mean for health.
Allow users to clear all input fields and reset the page easily.
Ensure the web page is responsive and looks good on various devices, including desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
Make sure the webpage is accessible to users with disabilities by following appropriate web accessibility guidelines.
Show website logo and name to create a strong brand impression.
Provide links to the main sections of the site: Home, Currency Converter, FAQ, Contact Us.
Highlight the currency converter with a prominent call-to-action button inviting users to start converting currencies immediately.
Briefly describe what the website does and its benefits, providing context for first-time visitors.
Present a dropdown list allowing users to select their starting currency.
Provide another dropdown for setting the desired currency for conversion.
Enable users to input an amount in the source currency they wish to convert.
A button that initiates calculation and displays the converted value when clicked.
Show the equivalent value in the target currency with two decimal precision.
Simulate live exchange rate updates when users interact, maintaining engagement through dynamic data representation.
Categorize questions into groups such as Usage Instructions, Currency Data, and Technical Support to help users find answers quickly.
Implement collapsible sections for each question so that users can expand and view responses without leaving the page.
Provide fields for name, email, subject, and message to facilitate user feedback or inquiries straightforwardly.
Ensure all required fields are filled before allowing users to submit the form, preventing incomplete submissions.
Offer a live chat feature where available for immediate assistance with questions or concerns.
Display a catchy headline introducing the password generator service.
Provide a brief overview of what a password generator does and its benefits.
Include a prominent button to 'Generate Password' directing users to the main functionality page.
Provide options for customizing password parameters such as length, use of uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.
Button to create a password based on selected criteria.
Showcase the newly generated password, allowing users to copy it to their clipboard.
Visual feedback on how strong the generated password is using a graphical bar (e.g., green for strong, yellow for medium, red for weak).
Allow users to easily copy the generated password to their clipboard with a single click.
Provide answers to common questions about how passwords are generated and why they are secure.
Enable users to reach out with feedback or queries by filling in a contact form.

functions.description: Provides general information about the QR code generator and its capabilities.
Offers links to main site sections such as 'About', 'Features', 'Pricing', and 'Contact Us'.
Displays the company's mission, history, and values.
Presents profiles of key team members and contributors.
Describes all the features available in the QR code generator, such as custom design options and analytics tracking.
Compares different subscription plans with their respective benefits and costs.
Provides an option to start a free trial of the service.
Allows users to input or paste the URL for which they want to generate a QR code.
Enables users to customize design elements such as colors, logo insertion, and label addition.
Activates the process of creating a QR code based on user input and selections.
Shows a preview of the generated QR codes.
Allows users to download the generated QR code in different formats like PNG or SVG.
Provides answers to common questions and troubleshooting tips.
Offers a way for users to reach out for further assistance or inquiries.
Presents the terms of service and privacy policy for user agreement and information on data handling practices.

function.description: Provide a brief overview of what the website does: explaining its purpose as a converter between Markdown and HTML.
Include clear, concise instructions on how to use the convertor functions available on the site.
Display prominent button for users to start using the converter.
Provide a text editor where users can input or paste their Markdown content.
Display converted HTML code in an easily readable format with syntax highlighting.
Enable a button that performs the conversion when clicked.
Show error messages if there's something wrong or invalid about the Markdown entered, providing helpful feedback to users.
Provide a text editor for inputting or pasting HTML code that needs conversion.
Render the converted Markdown in an easy-to-read format, possibly with basic formatting previews.
A button to initiate HTML to Markdown conversion upon user action.
Display error notifications or warnings if the HTML provided has syntax issues preventing accurate conversion.
Offer a list of common questions and answers to assist users in resolving basic queries about the tool's function and limitations.
Provide examples and explanations for Markdown and HTML syntax commonly used with the convertor.
Outline how users' data (input text) is handled, including any storage practices or privacy policies.
Include a form to gather user feedback or bug reports regarding the converter.
Provide information on how and where users can get additional help if needed.
Display a welcoming message introducing the Todo application.
Provide quick stats on total, completed, and pending tasks.
Direct users to enter or manage their todo items.
Allow users to input and save a new todo task with details like title, description, due date, and priority.
Display all tasks in a list format where each item shows its title, status, due date, and priority.
Enable users to filter tasks by various criteria like status (completed/pending), date range, or priority level.
Allow users to update the title, description, due date and priority of an existing task.
Provide a toggle option for marking tasks as completed or resetting them as incomplete.
Show complete details of the task including title, description, due date, assigned user (if applicable), and priority level.
Allow direct editing of task details such as title, description, due date, and priority while viewing a specific task.
Display a chart showing completion trends over time for the user's tasks.
Provide insights on how priorities are distributed across pending and completed tasks.
Allow users to update their personal information, such as name, email address, and notification preferences.
Provide options for managing task-related notifications via different channels like email or mobile push.
Allow users to securely log into their account using username and password, including support for OAuth options if needed.
Enable new users to register with necessary details like email and password to gain full access to the Todo application.
A brief welcome message introducing the budget control application to new users.
Options for users to create a new account or log into an existing one.
Quick highlights of key features offered by the app such as budget tracking, alerts, and reporting.
A dynamic chart displaying changes in balance over time to help users visualize their spending trends.
An up-to-date list of the most recent transactions categorized by type and amount.
A summary view showing total budget allocations, current expenses, and remaining balance.
Form to input details of a new transaction including date, category, amount spent or received, and notes if necessary.
Options to modify the details of existing transactions or remove them from records entirely.
Users can define their total budget for each month, customized by category if desired.
Capability to modify or create new categories within a monthly budget for tailored control over spending.
Users can configure alerts to be notified when approaching set spending limits or if the balance falls below a certain threshold.
Options for how and when users want to receive notifications about budget updates, warnings, or reminders.
Users can generate reports to view detailed analyses of spending patterns over selected periods—weekly, monthly, quarterly, etc.
Functionalities to download the generated reports in various formats like PDF or CSV for external use or record-keeping.
Users can update their profile information including name, email address, and password.
Options for users to manage data privacy settings and opt-in or out of data collection features.
Authenticate user to access the calendar application.
Allow new users to create an account.
Display a brief overview of monthly schedules and important notes.
Show quick stats on upcoming events for the current month.
Display a visual monthly calendar with dates, including any scheduled events or notes.
Provide functionality to add new events, meetings, or reminders on specific days.
Allow users to modify existing events' date, time, title, and details.
Enable users to remove unwanted or canceled events from the calendar.
Display comprehensive details about a selected event, including time, location, and participants.
Allow users to send event details via email or messaging applications.
Provide options to receive reminders for upcoming events at specified times.
Enable users to update personal information such as name, email, and profile picture.
Allow customization of notification preferences for different types of events.
Provide options to export calendar data or backup in desired formats like CSV, PDF, etc.
List frequently asked questions and their answers related to using the calendar application.
Provide a contact form or email link for user inquiries and technical support requests.
A welcoming message and prominent branding of the AI Chatbot.
Brief introduction to what the chatbot does and its core benefits.
Interactive button or link encouraging users to learn more about the product features, sign up, or try a demo.
Detailed descriptions of each feature with bullet points highlighting key benefits.
Embedded videos or live demos illustrating the chatbot's capabilities in action.
Clear explanations on how each feature solves user problems or enhances efficiency.
A form for users to register and create a personal account with the chatbot service.
Guided interactive session where users can try basic commands or questions in a sample conversation.
Quotes from satisfied customers describing their positive experiences with the chatbot.
Star ratings or other rating mechanisms that reflect user satisfaction and trustworthiness.
List of common questions about the chatbot with concise answers, categorized for easy navigation.
A search bar to quickly find specific information within the FAQs section.
Form for users to send inquiries directly to the support or sales team with a required response time.
Real-time chat support feature that allows immediate communication with customer service representatives.
The story of the company, its mission, and vision for implementing the AI Chatbot.
Introduction to team members with expertise in relevant fields that underline trust and credibility.

functions.description: Greet users when they visit the site and give a brief overview of the calorie tracker application.
Provide options for new users to sign up for an account or existing users to sign in.
Offer a link or button to access a quick start guide or tutorial on using the calorie tracker.
Show users their current daily caloric intake alongside their set goals.
Allow users to add new food items consumed throughout the day for calorie tracking.
Provide a breakdown of calories, macros (carbohydrates, proteins, fats), and other nutritional information for daily intake.
Include a search bar to help users quickly find specific food items in the database.
Allow users the ability to add custom entries that are not listed in the food database.
Enable users to specify the quantity of food consumed for accurate calorie calculation.
Provide a button for submitting the entered data which will update their daily caloric intake.
Allow users to update their personal information including age, weight, height, and activity level.
Provide options for users to set or modify their daily caloric intake goals based on individual needs.
Display a log of food entries with corresponding calories consumed per day, sorted by date.
Offer charts and graphs for users to visually interpret calorie trends, averages, and deviations over time.
Provide options for scheduling notifications/reminders for meal logging throughout the day.
Enable users to control privacy settings regarding who can see their calorie data and insights.
Offer a list of frequently asked questions for common issues or inquiries about the app’s functionality.
Provide email or chat support options for personalized assistance with any technical problems or queries.

function.description: Ensure the welcome message element is visible on the Home page.
Verify that the navigation button to the password generator is present and functional on the Home page.
Check if the 'About' link is displayed and leads to the About page correctly from the Home page.
Confirm that the description of the website's purpose and functionality is visible on the About page.

functions.description: Displays a summary of recent claims, current budget status, and other key metrics.
Directs the user to the claim submission form for entering new expense claims.
Allows employees to enter details of travel-related expenses along with required documents and justification.
Provides a form for entering labor-related costs incurred by employees, such as wages or contractor fees.
Enables entry of expenses related to management and administrative functions.
Allows for the submission of claims related to purchasing or using equipment.
Submits a complete claim for review, changing status to 'Pending'.
Shows employees their submitted claims and current statuses, i.e., Pending, Approved, Rejected.
Allows the administrator to approve a submitted claim, changing its status from 'Pending' to 'Approved'.
Enables the administrator to reject a submitted claim, updating its status to 'Rejected'.
Displays all claims with details and statuses for administrative review.
Provides tools for the administrator to analyze current budget status against planned budgets.
Allows viewing of expenses broken down by category such as Travel, Labor, Management, and Equipment.
Employees can view detailed information regarding their submitted claims.
Provides functionality for employees to modify or add information to a claim that is still in 'Pending' status.

function.description: Allows administrators to enter and save customer details including name, birthday, age, sex, company, and phone number.
Enables updating and modification of existing customer information as required.
Allows administrators to enter new products with details like name, category, and recommended price.
Enables modification of product information such as updating the category or recommended price.
Allows administrators to assign one or more preferred products to a customer's profile.
Captures details of a purchase record including datetime, product, quantity, and amount for each transaction associated with a customer.
Displays all past purchases made by a specific customer along with relevant details like date, products, and total amounts.
Provides an overview of sales performance metrics including totals by product and customer segments over varied time periods.
Analyzes sales trends to identify popular products, peak purchasing times, or customer buying patterns over time.
Enables administrators to quickly find and filter customers based on their details such as name, company or contact information.
Display the 'Hello, World!' message when a user visits the webpage.
Ensure the layout adapts to different screen sizes and devices for optimal viewing experience.
Minimize loading time by optimizing resources such as images, scripts, and stylesheets.
Provides a button for users to directly navigate from the homepage to the 'helloworld' page.
Displays the text or message 'Hello, World!' on opening the 'helloworld' page.
Open 'Spring Semester Subjects.xlsx' from the specified directory.
Identify and read the header row containing ['#', 'Name', 'Weekday', 'Time'].
Iterate through all rows beneath the header to collect subject data.
Map 'First period', 'Second period', 'Third period', and 'Fourth period' into numerical indices (e.g., 1, 2, 3, 4).
Arrange the data into a two-dimensional table structure categorizing subjects based on each time slot.
Initialize a new Excel file named according to user specification ('Processed_Spring_Subjects.xlsx').
Insert the header for the two-dimensional table with ['Time', 'Subjects in Time Slot'].
Fill the Excel file with subjects categorized under their respective time periods.
Ensure that 'Processed_Spring_Subjects.xlsx' is saved properly in the desired location.
Properly close any open Excel instances to free up system resources.
Ensure the dataset 'Gamedata.xlsx' is compatible with batch data processing software such as Python/Excel/VBA.
Read and load the 'Gamedata.xlsx' file into a suitable data structure for manipulation.
Check that all required columns, especially the dependent variable 'result', are present in the dataset.
Generate a one-period-lag for the 'result' column to use as the new dependent variable in the logistic model.
Ensure all other columns are readied as independent variables; check data types and handle missing values if necessary.
Define the logistic regression model using the lagged 'result' variable as dependent and remaining columns as independent variables.
Apply statistical methods to fit the logistic model to the data.
Organize the output of the model to include key metrics and statistics such as coefficients, significance levels, etc.
Export the summary results of the logistic regression into a new worksheet within 'Logistic.xlsx'.
Develop a batch file or script to automate reading data, transforming it, building the logistic model, and writing output.
Run the program to ensure all steps are executed correctly and output is as expected.
Ensure robust error handling within script for compatibility, data issues, or computation errors during model fitting.
Generate logs that record the flow of operations and any potential issues encountered during execution.
Display login screen for username and password input.
Validate user credentials against stored data or defaults.
Show main menu options such as Start Game, Load Game, Settings, and Exit.
Capture user's selection from the menu and trigger corresponding action.
Allow users to create or select a character with attributes.
Enable selecting of game difficulty options like Easy, Medium, Hard.
Show textual description of the current room and available exits/exits.
Collect player input for navigation or actions like 'go north', 'take item'.
Display current inventory items held by the player.
Enable using or dropping an item from the player's inventory.
Serialize current game state to a file for later retrieval.
Deserialize saved game state from file to resume where left off.
Evaluate conditions to determine if the player has completed the game successfully.
Show a message upon winning, losing, or exiting, with appropriate options like replay or exit.
Load the 'Deathlist.csv' file into a suitable data structure for processing, ensuring that the program can access and interpret the contents of the CSV.
Verify the format of 'Date of death' to ensure consistency before processing. Handle any discrepancies or invalid dates according to predefined rules or constraints.
Convert 'Date of death' strings into a standardized date format that can be used for further processing, such as grouping by weeks.
Determine the week number for each entry's 'Date of death' to facilitate weekly aggregation of deaths.
Count and group the number of deaths based on the calculated week numbers, resulting in a total count per week.
Choose and load the necessary graphics library or tool for generating histograms within the batch environment.
Organize weekly death counts into a structure compatible with the chosen histogram generation tool, ensuring it can be visualized correctly.
Utilize the prepared data to generate a graphical histogram that visually represents the number of deaths per week, adjusting aesthetics as necessary for clarity and readability.

functions.description: Provides access to main sections like Blog Posts, Categories, About Us, and Contact.
Showcases a few featured or latest blog articles for quick viewing.
Allows users to search for specific topics or keywords within the site.
Displays a list of blog posts with titles, dates, authors, and short summaries.
Enables users to filter posts by categories, tags, or publish date.
Provides navigation between multiple pages of blog post listings.
Displays the full content of a selected blog article along with images if applicable.
Provides details about the post's author, possibly including an author bio and contact link.
Allows users to navigate to previous or next posts in a series or archive.
Lists all available categories with an option to view all posts within selected category.
For broad categories, provides links to more specific subcategories where applicable.
Introduces the team behind the blog, including members’ roles and brief bios.
Outlines the mission or vision of the blog or its authors.
Allows users to submit messages with their contact details and inquiries.
Provides links to social media profiles where the blog is active.
Displays a list of posts matching search criteria with titles and summaries.
Informs the user when no blog posts match their search query, offering to refine the search or browse categories.
